Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Craig> Alright let me try to ask a legit question. 
Which "big" projects (in terms of market cap or hype) would work better if they were in the Komodo ecosystem? 
For example, why or why not was it a good idea to for Binance to build on tendermint / cosmos rather than a kmododo chain? 
Or, how would the synthetix project work on Komodo vs Ethereum? 
Or, HEX is probably a pretty terrible project. But if you were Richard Heart, why or why not would you have built it inside Komodo?
My question isn't about those three projects in particular. If you have ever looked into a project and thought "they should do that on komodo" then please explain why. And maybe why you think they didn't use Komodo although they should have

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> Namely the reason is because features and reference implementations are not complete yet.   Most people choose a platform like Eth to build on because of 1) they want to raise money and Eth is more liquid 2) They aren‚Äôt capable of running their own network.  ,  why this is a bad idea is lack of scalability,  a taxation model that will screw your business.  Re: Tendermint,   Why someone wants to use that namely is because of control ( dpos is pretty centralized ),  why it‚Äôs a bad choice is because zones offer little in the way of interoperability .
